strings.Value: [Put the gift in the bag] "There, I put your gift away. Now explain what's going on."
[Put the gift in the bag] "Thank you!"
"May I at least kiss you in return?"
"Now I'm sorry I haven't gotten anything for you. I'll make it up to you, I promise."
{n}Looking around, Valerie hastily hands you a parcel.{/n} "This is for you. From me. Please, take it."
{n}It's a beautifully embroidered silk shirt, carefully wrapped. Catching your glance, Valerie blushes ever so slightly.{/n} "Please put it away in your bag."
{n}Valerie turns crimson red.{/n} "On the contrary! It's you who's acting strange. You get a present and respond in this way!" {n}The girl scoffs and looks away.{/n} "Forget it."
{n}Valerie's blush deepens.{/n} "You're welcome! But put it away, hurry!" {n}She turns away hastily.{/n}
{n}Valerie shrugs her shoulders angrily.{/n} "I'm not embarrassed at all! I just don't want anyone to see it and... it doesn't matter!"
{n}Valerie turns crimson red.{/n} "And you are obnoxious!" {n}The girl scoffs and turns away.{/n}

{n}Valerie shrugs one shoulder.{/n} "Nothing special. I just thought I'd give you a present. What's wrong with that? We aren't strangers... I guess... And I decided I wanted to give you a shirt. That's it."

{n}Valerie presses a finger to her cheek with mock thoughtfulness.{/n} "In that case I wouldn't mind a romantic camp dinner. Oysters a la 'Whiterose'. Or at least smoked trout and hydra paste." {n}Valerie winks at you and turns away.{/n}
{n}Valerie looks around, embarrassed, then hastily kisses you and turns away.{/n} "Enough. Anything else â€” you'll have to wait until we're alone."
{n}Valerie looks at you like she's about to add something, then sighs and looks away.{/n}
